column1: A real President would spend his last days of his term pushing COVID relief through Congress to help people keep their homes jobs and businesses. https://t.co/pOemnlpyfS

As COVID-19 cases increase in New Mexico and across the country it's critical to make sure you and your family have access to quality affordable health care.   Be sure to #GetCovered before Open Enrollment ends on December 15 by visiting https://t.co/bpBjoA2LEO.

This is outrageous. Indian Country has been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.   Suspending emergency and inpatient services at the ACL Hospital will be devastating for the people of Acoma Laguna and To’Hajiilee and the surrounding communities. https://t.co/myCDQbL1i4

The record for the most COVID-19 cases recorded in a single day has again been shattered both in New Mexico and across the country.    It is way past time for @senatemajldr and Senate Republicans to get their priorities straight and stop stalling on much-needed pandemic relief.

I just spoke on the Senate Floor about #WhatsAtStake if Judge Barrett is confirmed to SCOTUS.    Americans desperately need COVID-19 relief.    Meanwhile Senate Republicans insist on taking up valuable time ramming through this sham nomination.  https://t.co/U6XaBGwrqx

Overturning the Affordable Care Act would mean discrimination higher costs and even outright denial of coverage for the more than 800000 New Mexicans living with pre-existing conditions like heart disease diabetes cancer and yes COVID-19. #WhatsAtStake
We’ve flattened the curve before and it’s time to do it again.   With COVID cases going up it’s critical you mask up. Keep your distance. Limit interactions and avoid mass gatherings.

The reports that @VP ordered @CDCgov to close America's borders—despite no evidence to show that this would slow the spread of COVID-19—are sickening.  @OIGatHHS must investigate this blatant political interference with our nation's public health response. https://t.co/P6QiQ4ahOH

By focusing on a SCOTUS nominee instead of much-needed COVID-19 relief President Trump and Majority Leader McConnell are showing their true colors: the American people are not their priority. https://t.co/9rhPdp9dop

If SCOTUS rules against the ACA around 20 million Americans will lose health coverage. Protections for preexisting conditions—which include COVID-19—will disappear.   This is all while we are struggling with a massive public health crisis. #WhatsAtStake https://t.co/hmJ3VgaLhW

TOMORROW: @NMDOH is holding free COVID-19 testing in Las Cruces on Saturday October 3rd from 8 to 10 AM at the Las Cruces Public Health Office (1170 N Solano Drive). If you plan to be tested you must register at https://t.co/dHYDs6HGGC. All testing is free of charge.

Nursing homes are particularly vulnerable to the spread of COVID-19. With this critical federal funding I am glad to see UNM's @ProjectECHO work to improve infection control strategies for more than 15000 nursing homes across the country. https://t.co/X7inMU1gAZ

The House passed the HEROES Act in May. Nearly 5 months ago.   It's almost October and @senatemajldr is hellbent on fast-tracking a SCOTUS nomination instead of helping the American people.   Majority Leader it's way past time to bring a COVID-19 relief bill to the Senate floor.

The Every Kid Outdoors program allows 4th graders to access our public lands for free. But because of COVID-19 many students were not able to fully utilize their passes this year. @SenAlexander and I are calling on @Interior to extend their passes for the 2020-2021 school year. https://t.co/KVPSBwj3Z0

TOMORROW: @NMDOH is holding free COVID-19 testing in Deming on Saturday September 26th from 8 to 10 AM at the Luna County Public Health Office (215 South Silver Ave).   If you plan to get tested you must register at https://t.co/LoSftRWN86. All testing is free of charge.

While @senatemajldr is trying to move heaven and earth to fill Justice Ginsburg's seat the American people are still suffering from the effects of this pandemic. People are dying. Businesses are hurting.    This is a disgrace. The Senate must pass COVID-19 relief now.

SUNDAY: @NMDOH is providing free COVID-19 testing in Roswell on Sunday September 20th at the Roswell Public Health Office (200 E Chisum) from 8:30 AM to 11:30 AM. To be tested you must register ahead of time at https://t.co/LoSftRWN86. All testing is completely free of charge.

15000 Navajo households lack access to electricity. COVID-19 has revealed just how badly these disparities impact the Navajo Nation.   My bill with @SenMcSallyAZ will reauthorize the Navajo Electrification Demonstration Program & help @NTUAutilities bring power to Navajo homes. https://t.co/EzwvNp7QNi

Yesterday I spoke with @KRWG about how Congress must pass more COVID-19 relief measures from rebuilding our economy to protecting the U.S. Postal Service and the integrity of the upcoming election.   Listen to my interview here ⬇️ https://t.co/8Yt5t1JO68
The United States has recorded over 5 million cases of the coronavirus. Millions of Americans remain out-of-work and without the help they need to put food on the table.

The NM COVID-19 Emergency Supply Collaborative (@CovidNm) has been doing tremendous work making sure New Mexico’s health care providers have the PPE they need to do their heroic work safely. https://t.co/8qJZbZgtc6

It is deeply disappointing to see Facebook ignoring disinformation about climate change while it aims to help its users fact check posts on other important scientific topics like COVID-19.   I am calling on Facebook to end this policy immediately. https://t.co/PjqBGu3iHz

As COVID-19 has left thousands of New Mexicans looking for new employment I remain committed to rebuilding strong economies in every part of our state.    I’ve partnered with @USOPM @NMDWS and @UNM to launch a Virtual Job Fair hosted on my website: https://t.co/SctO6eIlJj. https://t.co/Zhhracp3H3

The permanent trauma President Trump is inflicting on innocent children is appalling and does not represent who we are as a nation. As we continue to deal with the impacts and spread of COVID-19 we need to ensure the health and safety of these children.

COVID numbers are surging workers are getting laid off AGAIN and what do POTUS and Mitch McConnell want to do about it?  Nothing.  McConnell is even shutting down efforts to deal directly with the pandemic or the economic aftermath on the Senate floor this week. https://t.co/TCDSYuc0hc

New Mexicans shouldn't have to worry about losing money because of travel plans disrupted by COVID-19.   I'm proud to cosponsor the Cash Refunds for Coronavirus Cancellations Act which will require airlines to offer full cash refunds for tickets canceled during the pandemic.

I'll be joining @NMLandOffice and @PoweringNM tomorrow at 4 p.m. MT to discuss New Mexico's clean energy future and how we can include the clean energy workforce in our nation's recovery from the COVID-19 crisis. Tune in tomorrow via Facebook Live! https://t.co/t0Xsrg688w
POTUS on COVID-19: “It’s fading away...”  Reality in a fact-based world: COVID-19 has now killed more Americans than the 1st World War and is surging in many states.

New corona cases in New Mexico = 94  New corona cases in Florida = 3823  It’s time for POTUS and Republican governors to stop ignoring COVID-19 or the damage to lives AND the economy will be devastating.  Willful ignorance is not a strategy.

Withholding life-saving COVID-19 data from tribal communities widens the health disparities that are already running rampant in areas ill-equipped to contain the spread and the outcomes of this pandemic.    I expect better from @CDCgov. Read my letter to Director Redfield below. https://t.co/cJcUbkQVCS
The new Trump administration strategy for COVID-19 is to pretend it doesn’t exist. Meanwhile numbers are surging in many states threatening lives and the economy.

It is unthinkable that while Tribal communities are being ravaged by COVID-19 this administration is eroding their right to protect the water within their borders from potentially destructive projects like pipelines and dams. https://t.co/ilxvQvQRi0
Bianca and all of the COVID-19 hotline staff thank you for your commitment to making sure that the public remains informed as well as helping ease their concerns.

Right now access to trusted information is critical. Bianca Gonzales a student pharmacist at the @UNMHSC College of Pharmacy volunteers with the @NMDOH COVID-19 hotline where she works diligently to provide callers with accurate and up-to-date information. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/yka526havz

We've been back in session for three weeks and McConnell has refused to address the COVID-19 crisis even saying we should “press the pause button.”  It would appear he is more interested in packing the courts than he is in packed hospital ICUs unemployment lines & food banks.

Sherry Hooper is the executive director of @TheFoodDepot a food bank serving northern New Mexico. She is leading the Food Depot's amazing effort to address New Mexico's sharp increase in food insecurity as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/qm4AvVnyw5

Jean has been stepping up to help the Taos area since before the COVID-19 crisis through her work supporting the ReUse Center in Chamisal as well as organizing community events. Her love and care for her community has left its mark on residents as they navigate this new reality.

Alice Davenport runs a one-person sewing and alterations shop in Las Cruces. When the COVID-19 pandemic began Alice knew that she could put her talent to use by making face masks and donating to the city's essential workers.  #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/HzFQMa2PdA

Last night @SenatorTomUdall and I sat down with @KRQE to discuss the federal response to the coronavirus pandemic and answer the questions New Mexicans have about the crisis. Watch our interview here: https://t.co/48BhZOcbms

When Erin Garrison's organization was disrupted by COVID-19 she found new ways to serve her community through the non-profit's mission. Food is Free Albuquerque was established to improve the availability of fresh local produce by helping distribute growers' surplus harvests.

New Mexico has long faced challenges providing adequate behavioral health resources and this has only been exacerbated by the COVID-19 crisis.    We must #FundMentalHealth because we can't allow this pandemic to create any lapses in behavioral health care for those who need it.

The great work being done through the NM COVID-19 Emergency Supply Collaborative (@CovidNM) makes deliveries like this possible. I'm proud to be partnered with them in the effort to connect our front line workers to the resources they need to continue their lifesaving work.
(2/2) McConnell and Trump are refusing to meet this moment with a serious economic recovery plan and McConnell is doing nothing COVID-related in the Senate this week.  UNBELIEVABLE!!!
There is a disease more devastating than COVID-19 and it’s on the rise. It’s called ignorance.  https://t.co/PY1HL5Pbha

#COVID19 is disproportionately impacting Tribal nations. That's why I've introduced legislation to eliminate the cost-share requirements tied to emergency protective measures which will allow Tribal governments to access 100% of the funding they need. https://t.co/vh460WSUoY

Peggy McCracken runs the Checkerboard Area Food Pantry which serves rural areas like Cuba and Gallina as well as the Navajo communities of Torreon and Ojo Encino. During the #COVID19 crisis the pantry has provided food to hundreds of families in need.#HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/pHSwLXyKhe

Hundreds of child care centers across New Mexico have been forced to close or serve just a percentage of the children they normally would. To help stabilize the industry we must prioritize emergency funding for child care in further #COVID19 legislation. https://t.co/ZWXTJweJyr

Protect NM is partnered with @CovidNm which was organized to help New Mexico health care providers and medical professionals get the resources they need. If you know of a facility in need visit https://t.co/JZmhZmxSqE.

Melisa Hart had to close her Albuquerque fabric store Stitchology due to #COVID19. But that didn't stop her from using her business and resources to help the community. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/hwR17LXcsV

Tribal nations in New Mexico are facing a disproportionate impact to their populations due to the coronavirus pandemic and access to the $8 billion Coronavirus Relief Fund is vital to their response and recovery efforts.

New Mexico's radio and television broadcasters and newspapers provide local and national news emergency alerts educational programs and more.   That's why I'm calling on OMB Acting Director Vought to support these trusted community news outlets during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/S8vyf9MDwD

To help Magdalena stay connected Linda Swisher-Smiley began MagEboard an online newsletter. Even before #COVID19 MagEboard served to keep residents informed not only about community happenings but also official notices like school closures & fire warnings. #HometownHeroesNM

A global health crisis means we are all in this together. The racist rhetoric surrounding the coronavirus is not only wrong but it also stirs hate and fear to divide us during a time when it is critical that we look out for one another. https://t.co/XV0AwEN4Y1

With @SandiaLabs now approved to begin #COVID19 testing New Mexico can expand its ability to process test results on a daily basis. I thank Sandia and its staff for their tireless work to assist in New Mexico’s coronavirus response efforts.  https://t.co/JEP7tHOkiv

Sandia has converted 100 respirators for New Mexico hospitals for use with COVID-19 patients. This will make a tremendous difference in equipping our health care workers as they save lives and treat New Mexicans during this pandemic. https://t.co/uW6vFc9gKy
Many of our health care heroes are immigrants and DACA enrollees. POTUS is making the #COVID19 crisis worse by shutting down ALL immigration.

The Tribal COVID-19 Disaster Cost Share Relief Act will waive FEMA’s cost share requirement for emergency protective measures that Tribal governments take in response to the pandemic. This will grant Tribal governments 100% of the funding they need to address this crisis.

#COVID19 is severely impacting Tribal nations as they face unprecedented costs to protect their communities’ health and safety. I’m introducing legislation that will help Tribal governments receive the full support of the federal government they need to respond to this crisis.
How about instead he does something that actually helps with COVID-19 like giving states more testing supplies?   https://t.co/xPtPjmGWF3

.@Protect_NM is accepting PPE donations today and tomorrow at various Albuquerque locations. You can drop off face masks and shields gowns and gloves. @CovidNm will distribute donated PPE to local health providers. If you know a facility in need visit https://t.co/jLRG9eXCCC https://t.co/iyQSvBzK1c

Cami Mallory had been doing great children’s advocacy work in ABQ before the #COVID19 crisis. Now in the face of the pandemic she & her family started their own organization Families Feeding Families specifically to help NM families facing food insecurity. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/JUrGMtt15o

I have agreed to serve on a White House task force comprised of Senators and Members of the House of Representatives to provide counsel to the President on the reopening of the American economy in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Read my full statement: https://t.co/t7uZcgmpDy

While our country fights to combat the COVID-19 pandemic continuing border wall construction places local communities at unnecessary risk. That’s why I’m joining @RepCuellar to call on the Trump admin to halt all border wall construction immediately.  https://t.co/AR6exJINQo

To keep up with the increase in #COVID19 patients NM needs more hospital beds. Weil Construction @USACE_ABQ and nearly 200 @IBEW and @UAPipeTrades craftsmen are working around the clock to remodel a defunct Albuquerque hospital. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/LPBT5EYc3b
The US leads the world in COVID-19 cases because we lag the rest of the world in testing. Coincidence? No it’s called public health science.

Small and rural communities face enormous economic burdens and costs in their effort to respond to #COVID19.   That’s why I’m leading the Senate version of the Coronavirus Community Relief Act to provide $250 billion to help stabilize localities with populations under 500000.

#COVID19 stay-at-home orders place victims of domestic violence at an increased risk and the programs working to support them are being strained.    Congress must stand up for survivors and prioritize the resources they desperately need in future COVID-19 relief legislation. https://t.co/HtZoYH2sDE

Donations can be dropped off at FUSE Makerspace in Albuquerque located at 101 Broadway Blvd. NE Suite 3100.  If you're looking for other ways to help or know a facility in need of supplies visit the @CovidNm site at https://t.co/JZmhZmxSqE.

.@FUSEMakerspace and @MakerHubAFRLNM are reaching out to New Mexico manufacturers wanting to donate supplies during the #COVID19 crisis. On Friday April 17 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. they will be accepting drop-off donations of 3D-printed face shields and the supplies to make them. https://t.co/X2xMSpaXAj

.@SenatorTomUdall and I are working around the clock to fight for New Mexicans during the #COVID19 pandemic and hold the Trump admin accountable every step of the way. Read our op-ed in the @ABQJournal: https://t.co/kmdHuUKK52

Rural hospitals like Gila Regional Medical Center are absolutely essential to the health of their communities. As we continue to grapple with #COVID19 I'll keep fighting to make sure our hospitals—especially rural hospitals—get the support they need. https://t.co/ad6uExgGjW

It's been over a year since the House passed #VAWA. As many stay home due to #COVID19 victims of domestic violence are being presented with a dangerous situation. It's time for the Senate to stand up for these survivors and vote to reauthorize VAWA immediately. #VAWA4ALL

Do you know someone in New Mexico who has made a significant difference in your life or community during the #COVID19 pandemic? Nominate a Hometown Hero here: https://t.co/gzVnW8mnRW #HometownHeroesNM

While 6-feet physical distancing is still the best way to slow the spread of #COVID19 @CDCgov now also recommends using face coverings when going into public places like grocery stores and pharmacies. Here's how to make your own with household items. https://t.co/qyR7z783GB

Medical supplies hospital beds and health care workers in Indian Country are facing great strains. We must do everything we can to deliver supplies like PPE and ventilators to hospitals and clinics serving tribal communities before it’s too late. #CoronavirusIndianCountry

The math is clear. Staying home reducing your interactions with others and maintaining physical distance can sharply reduce the spread of the deadly coronavirus and save the lives of our fellow New Mexicans. https://t.co/NrS7r9qOuY

Please do your part! Together we can help reduce the spread of COVID-19 and protect the health of our friends neighbors and family members. Follow New Mexico’s Stay-at-Home instructions and keep physical distance from others. You will save the lives of your fellow New Mexicans. https://t.co/y5Qe3sqHta

Last night the Senate passed the bipartisan #COVID19 relief package.   This legislation will make a real difference in delivering resources that New Mexico needs to meet this crisis head on and rebuild our communities in the weeks and months ahead. https://t.co/wGK7k5vkD6

The “stay-at-home” rules ordered by @GovMLG are the most effective way for us to reduce the spread of the coronavirus and protect the health of our friends our neighbors and our family members. https://t.co/7z5Ed3mIzG

I am urging the Trump administration to do everything possible to engage the researchers and scientists at New Mexico's national laboratories to find solutions to the coronavirus pandemic. My full statement below: https://t.co/GMS0Q3rYQk

The last thing we need in a public health crisis is for people to be afraid of seeking treatment because of the cost.   That’s why I'm calling on major health insurers to cover all COVID-19 related treatment without cost sharing requirements.

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act will: ✅ Rapidly expand free COVID-19 testing for those who need it ✅ Provide funding to ensure meals are provided to those in need ✅ Ensure workers can access paid leave and unemployment insurance

Yesterday I called on POTUS to the invoke Defense Production Act to strengthen domestic manufacturing capacity & supply of personal protective equipment ventilators diagnostic test kits & other vital supplies critical to the COVID-19 response. Good to see him follow through. https://t.co/TMDwQEnlSG
As we all navigate through this worrisome time I want to express my deepest gratitude to the health professionals who are on the front lines fighting the COVID-19 pandemic.

Yesterday I spoke on the phone with both Vice President Mike Pence and FDA Commissioner Dr. Stephen Hahn about what the federal government needs to do to expand COVID-19 testing in New Mexico. https://t.co/0nUCfUXkeO

Your actions can make a big difference in keeping others safe and healthy and help slow the spread of #COVID19 . Take steps to protect yourself and others. https://t.co/NGHX9shUcz https://t.co/31GMTIBaXM
The size of your pocketbook shouldn’t affect your ability to be tested for COVID-19. That’s why I’m supporting legislation to expand free testing.  https://t.co/4tAU2ayDjp

I’m introducing legislation to expand free tests to confirm coronavirus infections.   In a public health crisis like #COVID19 it’s critical to be able to identify and contain positive cases in our communities. If somebody needs to be tested they should be able to receive one.

.@NMecondev is hosting a webinar TODAY at 12 PM MDT to discuss steps being taken to help NM businesses deal with the negative economic impacts of #COVID19. The webinar is free to attend but registration is required. Register to watch here: https://t.co/EswQt7jAxI

Albuquerque’s TriCore Reference Laboratories is now able to perform diagnostic tests for COVID-19. This will greatly expand our state’s capacity for testing. I will keep working to ensure that our state has the resources it needs to protect public health and keep families safe.
My statement with @SenatorTomUdall on the latest developments on #COVID19 in New Mexico: https://t.co/P1wghDzS7q

WATCH: NM Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham addresses the state as the first three presumptive positive cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed. I urge every New Mexican to continue taking preventative actions to protect themselves and mitigate the potential spread. https://t.co/bJWWJxnvst

I’ll always fight for better family leave policies and I’m proud to join @PattyMurray and @rosadelauro to introduce legislation to provide paid sick days immediately to workers in light of the coronavirus crisis and in preparation for future public health emergencies.

.@CDC recommends staying home if you're sick to help prevent the spread of #COVID19.   But the lack of a national paid leave program puts many workers in the impossible position of choosing between their health and a paycheck. https://t.co/kkuHKlQ7Th

As I continue to work with local state and federal officials to ensure our public health infrastructure in New Mexico is ready for what we may face with the coronavirus I encourage everyone to do your part to better prepare yourself and your family.  https://t.co/Pg3rTpbaz1
This is utterly false.  The Trump administration is completely disorganized and unprepared for the coronavirus.  https://t.co/JjcUscuTYb

Yesterday the CDC confirmed the first U.S. case of coronavirus spread from person-to-person contact. As @CDCgov anticipates more U.S. cases it's important to get the facts about what @WHO has now declared a public health emergency. https://t.co/6OT9pXO3jv

China perpetuates the sale of wild animals like civets bats & snakes in food markets. That’s what gave us SARS & now this deadly coronavirus. They are putting endangered wildlife at risk of extinction & they are endangering the lives of people worldwide.  https://t.co/sdAwBubIKp
